attributes.action: Ban filibustering in the House of Commons
attributes.additional_details: On November 3 the Representation of the People (Young People’s Enfranchisement and Education) Bill was not moved to a vote in spite of there being enough MPs to force a vote due to the tactic of filibustering.
attributes.background: Many useful bills put forward by individual MPs and supporeted by the public are talked out deliberately - or filibustered. A recent example of this is the bill that called for 16 year olds to be allowed the vote. Ban this cynical and deliberate way of blocking useful debate and legislation
